Maintenance & Technical Support Services GTS IA DR ST03 ST04 ST05 UNDERSTAND the client business and need EXPLORE options and approach DEVELOP and agree to client solution CustomerRefs crdb 0 0 2009 2011 Offerings/Services/Solutions SK C0 CRR Southwest Europe IOT Paris 12KY-WUICP9 France Financial Markets No Systèmes Technologiques d'Echange et de Traitement is a leading provider of infrastructure services to the European payment industry. The company processes all payment instruments including cards, ATMs, credit transfers, direct debits and checks. On a peak day the company’s next-generation CORE platform processes over 120 million payments for a total annual volume in excess of 13 billion payments. As a Systemically Important Payment System (SIPS) under euro system criteria, Systèmes Technologiques d'Echange et de Traitement operates under central bank oversight and complies with the core principles set by the BIS and Eurosystem for SIPS. EW Southwest Europe IOT 3F France IMT FR France EW 3F FR S Financial Markets A French provider of infrastructure services to the European payment industry optimizes the quality of its service offerings when it engages IBM Global Technology Services - maintenance and technical support to provide comprehensive hardware and software support for its IT infrastructure, especially its IBM System p5 servers and storage area network (SAN) architecture Business Continuity Express Selected Business Solution (sBS) Automation Systems & Network Management Systèmes Technologiques d'Echange et de Traitement is in charge of daily compensation between banks. In fact, financial exchanges between banks must be done before a certain hour, otherwise fees are demanded for the delay. Consequently, the company must provide a reliable service to its banking clients, while guaranteeing high confidentiality as it is required in the banking industry. Moving forward, Systèmes Technologiques d'Echange et de Traitement needed to adopt a comprehensive maintenance solution to ensure the high-quality and continuous operation of its IT infrastructure. Systèmes Technologiques d'Echange et de Traitement engaged IBM Global Technology Services - maintenance and technical support to provide comprehensive hardware and software support for its IT infrastructure, especially its IBM System p5 servers and storage area network (SAN) architecture. The IBM maintenance and technical support contract provides 24/7 maintenance services with a four-hour response time guarantee. Systèmes Technologiques d'Echange et de Traitement’s new contract with IBM maintenance and technical support successfully:- Optimizes the company’s quality of services by avoiding possible hardware or operating system incidents- Provides high reactivity, notably due to the possibility of resolving technical issues within four hours- Delivers best-practices consulting for its operating system environment. cvi:originalDocument.DisplayHTML:
Systèmes Technologiques d'Echange et de Traitement

IBM Client Reference

Published 27 Dec 2009    Last updated/reviewed 18 May 2011

 
  • Solution synopsis
  • Client information
  • Special handling instructions
  • Business need
  • Solution implementation
  • Benefit of the solution
  • Contact information
  • Client printable version
  • Additional reference details
  • Request to use this reference
  • Ask a question about this reference

Solution synopsis


A French provider of infrastructure services to the European payment industry optimizes the quality of its service offerings when it engages IBM Global Technology Services - maintenance and technical support to provide comprehensive hardware and software support for its IT infrastructure, especially its IBM System p5 servers and storage area network (SAN) architecture

Back to top

Client information

Client name:
Location:
Systèmes Technologiques d'Echange et de Traitement
Paris France
Industry: Financial Markets
Focus area: Business Continuity, Express, Selected Business Solution (sBS), Automation, Systems & Network Management
Integrated/Aligned Account
Geography/IOT/GMU: Southwest Europe IOT
Region/IMT/GMT: France IMT
Client background:
Systèmes Technologiques d'Echange et de Traitement is a leading provider of infrastructure services to the European payment industry. The company processes all payment instruments including cards, ATMs, credit transfers, direct debits and checks. On a peak day the company’s next-generation CORE platform processes over 120 million payments for a total annual volume in excess of 13 billion payments. As a Systemically Important Payment System (SIPS) under euro system criteria, Systèmes Technologiques d'Echange et de Traitement operates under central bank oversight and complies with the core principles set by the BIS and Eurosystem for SIPS.
URL: N/A
Project start: 01/2007
Project end: 12/2011

Back to top

Special handling instructions

Please do not use this reference without the previous agreement of the sales representative.

The client has agreed to be a reference for sales situations. The status of any installation or implementation can change, so you should always contact the Primary Contact or Additional Contact named in the reference prior to discussing it with your client.

Any public use, such as in marketing materials, on WWW sites, in press articles, etc., requires specific approval from the client. It is the responsibility of the person or any organization planning to use this reference to make sure that this is done. The IBM representative will, as appropriate, contact the client for review. You should not contact the client directly.

Business need

Systèmes Technologiques d'Echange et de Traitement is in charge of daily compensation between banks. In fact, financial exchanges between banks must be done before a certain hour, otherwise fees are demanded for the delay. Consequently, the company must provide a reliable service to its banking clients, while guaranteeing high confidentiality as it is required in the banking industry. Moving forward, Systèmes Technologiques d'Echange et de Traitement needed to adopt a comprehensive maintenance solution to ensure the high-quality and continuous operation of its IT infrastructure.

Back to top

Solution implementation

Systèmes Technologiques d'Echange et de Traitement engaged IBM Global Technology Services - maintenance and technical support to provide comprehensive hardware and software support for its IT infrastructure, especially its IBM System p5 servers and storage area network (SAN) architecture. The IBM maintenance and technical support contract provides 24/7 maintenance services with a four-hour response time guarantee.

Back to top

Benefit of the solution

Systèmes Technologiques d'Echange et de Traitement’s new contract with IBM maintenance and technical support successfully:
- Optimizes the company’s quality of services by avoiding possible hardware or operating system incidents
- Provides high reactivity, notably due to the possibility of resolving technical issues within four hours
- Delivers best-practices consulting for its operating system environment.

Solutions/Offerings

Services:

IBM Global Technology Services - Maintenance & Technical Support Services: GTS Maintenance & Technical Support: Hardware Maintenance; GTS Maintenance & Technical Support: Software Support

Industry Solutions:

FSS: FM - Financial Market Data Management

Back to top

Reference type:

The following reference uses are ones which the client was willing to do at the time of publication. This may or may not reflect the current situation.
Client Phone Call, Talk to Broadcast Media (TV/Radio), Talk to Consultant/Analyst, Talk to Press (Press Article/Press Release)

Please be aware that in some countries English may not be the language of choice for communications. Contact with the reference client may require use of another language and/or translation. You should take advice from the IBM contact named in the reference before contacting the client.


     

Back to top

Request to use or ask a question (English language)

The submit request to use this reference enables you to ask the reference primary contact if their client is willing to participate in a specific reference activity. An email will be sent to the reference primary contact with a response back to you to accept or decline your request.

The ask primary contact a question function helps users learn more about this reference, eliminating the same question being asked of the reference primary contact multiple times. Use this to ask the primary contact specific questions.

Back to top
